Class ScoreBubble

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • ScoreBubble

  • public class ScoreBubble
extends GameObject
    This class represents a type of GameObject whose job is to provide feedback to the player after they hit a Mole. There are currently 5 legal 'types' of ScoreBubble objects each uniquely instantiated by passing the name of its type as a parameter to the constructor. All of these types are of the same class as their behavior is identical in each case, differing only by the images they display. ScoreBubble objects present themselves as floating textual graphics that rise up like helium balloons and slowly fade or moles holding failing papers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScoreBubble

        public ScoreBubble(java.lang.String type,
                   float x,
                   float y)
        This constructor builds a ScoreBubble of the type indicated by the String passed in as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        type - the name of the kind of ScoreBubble to create, either professorHammer, professorRuler, deanHammer, deanRuler, or plusSeconds.
        x - the horizontal component of the object's location on the frame
        y - the vertical component of the object's location on the frame

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        Marks this ScoreBubble object to be removed if the amount of time it has existed exceeds the total duration of the animation sequence of this object's Sprite
        Overrides:
        update in class GameObject

      • getIsMarkedForDeath

        public boolean getIsMarkedForDeath()
        Returns:
        returns true if this ScoreBubble object is marked to be removed, and false otherwise.
